page.title: 09Employment, Staploe
page.content: Farming is by far the largest employer. 29 males declared themselves involved as farmers, managers, foremen, mechanics,a stockman, a game keeper and a student, as well as general workers and tractor drivers. Women and itinerant workers are employed on grading and piecework. Everyone else travels. Car ownership is high, only about 10 households are without one. Most travel to the St. Neots area, to work in the paper mill, insurance offices, stores or for the Eastern Electricity Board. One is a travel agent, one a postman, another works for the Anglian Water Authority at Grafham Water. To Bedford travel 3 engineers, a warehouseman and a Building Inspector; to Stevenage, 2 engineers and a research worker. There is one unemployed male householder.
